page.title: 01WELBY VILLAGE
page.content: The block itemised 1 tp 12 cover ,ostly typical Lincolnshire farmland, medium to heavy loam, centred on the village of Welby. Welby was named by the Saxons it would seem. The population is 113 housed in 65 dwellings, including farmhouses. The majority of the land is arable and is worked to produce a variety of crops basically cereals but also sugar beet, peas, oil seed rape, mustard. Almost nil vegetables. The majority of villagers work in the surrounding district or the adjoining towns and in other than the farming industry. In the main the district is owned by Sir Bruno Welby Bt. although recently land plots or disused buildings have been sold and developed privately. St. Batholemews is 13th century and a poorly attended church. The public house and an industrial building is
